results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Greek Boy Scouts and Girl Guides supporting Bishop at Festival Hall]
results.brief_description:
This silent film shows the Greek Boy Scouts and other children assembling to celebrate National Day of the Greek Community, 25th March 1966 at Festival Hall, Melbourne.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: First Greek Community Dance at Exhibition Centre 1961]
results.brief_description:
This film shows the first Greek Community Dance held at the Royal Exhibition Buildings, Melbourne in 1961.

The film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Easter celebrations at Green Hill]
results.brief_description:
This film shows Greek Easter celebrations, including a community BBQ, cooking lamb on a spit, music and dancing.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Arrival of the Greek Ship "Patris" at Victoria Dock 1]
results.brief_description:
This film shows the arrival of the Greek ship ‘Patris’ to Victoria Dock in 1961 and her passengers coming to Australia to start a new life.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.
results.title_for_label: [Tony Agapitos: Arrival of the Greek Ship “Patris” at Victoria Dock 1]
results.description:

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: 3ZZ Protest March]
results.brief_description:
‘Protest March, Melbourne’ (circa 1975-77) shows a protest march in Melbourne in the mid-1970s in support of multi-lingual community radio station 3ZZ, with crowds gathering at City Square then marching up Swanston Street.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: Science fiction our reality

holdings.name: VHS [PAL]; Reference - timecoded

results.title: 16mm Prints
results.brief_description:
1. Granville Cattle Shoot - Unedited footage of bulldozers and men clearing land in order to create pens to house cattle. Cattle is then shot in the head and picked-up by a bulldozer/tractor that dumps the dead, or close to dead body in a pit with other bloodied carcases. The pit of dead cows is then filled with soil.

  2. Mice Milking - Documents the process in which scientists at Dandenong milk mice with special machinery. The milk is then given to the American Cancer Council who use it to research cancer treatment. A mouse attached to the milking machine looks quite bizarre. One mouse yeilds a third of a teaspoon of milk per milking session. Good footage of the machine in action.

  3. The problem of Lamb Survival - Shows how the Department of Agriculture is trying to improve the amount of lambs that are born each year and survive to adulthood. Includes footage of a mobile laboratory in the field.

  4. N.A.S.A moon shots - Filmed photographs of general space imagery, focusing on the moon and spacecraft. Contains photograph or earth from space.

  5. Eclipse 23/10/76’ - Rushes of countryside, sheep and cars in the day and at night.
